page.title: 10The Chiltern Hospital(cont.)
page.content: Over a thousand patients are treated each year,about four each week are children. They are mostly in-patients. Over sixty surgeons work at the hospital and operations are performed there every week. It is an acute care hospital and not a casualty hospital. The patients have their breakfast at half past seven. They may have coffee, tea or fruit juice whenever they want. The chef cooks over three hundred meals a day. At lunch they have three choices for the main course and two for dinner. If they do not want what is on the menu the chef will cook them something else. Special menus are sent to the patients who can choose what they want. The beds in the hospital are very elaborate;the patients can have them in many different positions,so that they are as comfortable as possible.
